item.description:
The Regent Theatre in Arlington is screening the documentary "Ayn Rand & the Prophecy of Atlas Shrugged" on Thursday, January 26.

We'll meet around 7:00-7:10 PM in the lobby and then head into the theatre to find seats.

If people are interested, we can head into Somerville/Cambridge afterward to grab a beer or hang out.

Here's the link to purchase tickets. Be sure your ticket is for the January 26 screening. http://www.regentthea...

 

It's a good opportunity to support a local business that is taking a risk by showing this type of film, especially in Arlington! "Ayn Rand & the Prophecy of Atlas Shrugged is a feature length documentary film that examines the resurging interest in Ayn Rand's epic and controversial 1957 novel and the validity of its dire prediction for America."

See the trailer here: http://www.youtube.co...

 

Parking info from the Regent site: "The Regent Theatre has FREE parking right across the street from the theatre on weeknights after 6pm, Saturday after 3pm, and all day Sunday! All spots are free (including “permit only” spots) after listed times."

The Regent Theatre is also very easy to get to via public transportation.  Take the Red Line to Harvard Station and then take the 77 bus (leaves every 15 minutes) to the Arlington Center stop.  The stop is in front of Papa Gino's and the Regent Theatre is right around the corner.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in lobby 7:00-7:10PM, or in the theatre
item.name: Movie Meetup: Ayn Rand & the Prophecy of Atlas Shrugged
